title: I. Pitches (16 points)
stimulusHtml:
The purpose of this question was to test the student’s ability to detect and notate outer voices of a four-part chorale texture correctly and analyze the chords through Roman numeral analysis aurally. The question tested more advanced aural skill recognition, specifically, chromaticism in the bass and a secondary dominant.

I. Pitches (16 points)

  • Award 1 point for each correctly notated pitch. Do not consider duration.

Notes

  1. Round any fractional scores up to the next higher point. (Exception: Round 23 1/2 down.)

  2. Accept the correct Roman numeral regardless of its case.

  3. Award full credit for octave transpositions of the correct bass pitch.

  4. Accept any symbol that means “of ” or “applied” at Chord Six (e.g., V/V, [V], V—>V, V of V, etc.).

  5. Accept capital II for the Roman numeral of Chord Six.

title: II Chord Symbols
stimulusHtml:
8 Points

Chord Symbols (8 points)

  • Award 1 point for each chord symbol correct in both Roman and Arabic numerals.

  • Award 1/2 point for each correct Roman numeral that has an incorrect or missing Arabic numeral.
descriptions: 0 Score for responses that represent an unsuccessful attempt to answer the question.
